data.title: Lola Lovell: all about Stacey Dash’s daughter

data.text:
The main reason for Lola Lovell’s fame is that she is the daughter of American actress Stacey Dash. On May 10, 2003 she was born in the United States. She does ballet professionally.

Lola Lovell Family

Brian Lovell and Stacey Lovell were Lola Lovell’s parents. Her father worked in the movie business. Their wedding day was July 16, 1999. They divorced in the mid-2000s, so they are no longer married. Her mother has been married four times. Secondly, Stacey married Sports Logistics CEO James Maby in 2005. They divorced in 2006.

Eventually, she married actor Emmanuel Xuereb in the late 2000s. Stacey filed for divorce and it was finalized in September 2011; They divorced in January. She just married Jeffrey Marty, a lawyer. The wedding took place on April 6, 2018. They are no longer together because Stacey filed for divorce in June 2020.

Due to her mother’s relationship with Christopher Williams, Lola has a brother named Austin Williams. She was born on October 29, 1991. Linda and Dennis Dash welcomed Stacey Dash into the world on January 20, 1967 in New York City. She is an actress who has acted in numerous films, including Clueless, Moving, Mo’Money, and Renaissance Man.

Stacey admitted to having a heroin addiction problem

He acknowledged in an interview that he had spent between $5,000 and $10,000 on drugs. She said no one knew that he used to take 18 to 20 tablets a day. Lola Lovell claimed that she began using drugs when she was eight years old and that her mother gave her her first line of cocaine when she was sixteen years old because both of her parents were drug users.

His mother smoked crack and used cocaine regularly, while his father was addicted to heroin. She claimed that she was about to die. She was rushed to the hospital where she received a whole blood transfusion and she spent three weeks because her kidneys were so bad that her blood was septic and her organs were failing.

Stacey was in an abusive relationship and had suffered assault as a child.

When Stacey was four years old, she was assaulted, as she told Dr. Oz. She said that she had forgotten about the incident until she attempted suicide at age 17. She claimed that when she was in her early twenties, her husband beat her so brutally that she could not get out of bed and could not walk for two weeks.

Loss He lost his job for refusing to perform sexual favors

In a 2017 interview, Stacey commented that as a Hollywood actor, you should expect this to happen. By this he meant that he has lost opportunities as a result of his refusal to perform sexual favors. He added a personal anecdote about how he got the role when he was 25 and showed up on location.

Since he did not want to perform nudity in the love scene, he said the director ordered him to enter his room. When she did, he answered the door inappropriately dressed, the curtains were drawn, and she was waiting for her to join him in bed. When she refused, he claimed he had been fired from her.
